articles.title: Kim Jong Il Enjoys Art Performance
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Enjoys Art Performance

					
						Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il enjoyed together with KPA servicepersons an art performance given by artistes of the Merited State Chorus, "Unhasu," the Mansudae Art Troupe, the Phibada Opera Troupe and the National Art Troupe.
						 They put on the stage chorus "Please Receive Our Salute", male solo and chorus "Song of Comradeship", orchestra and chorus "The Snow Falls", female  trio "The Glow over Kangson", female  quartet and mixed chorus "May the Motherland Prosper" and other colorful numbers.
						
						 At the end of the performance he waved back to the cheering performers and audience and congratulated them on their successful presentation. 
						
						 He expressed great satisfaction over the most splendid performance flawless in the ideological contents and artistry staged by artistes of the Merited State Chorus and other national art troupes and extended high appreciation and thanks to them for their successful performance. 
						
						 The orchestra and chorus "The Snow Falls", female quartet and mixed chorus "May the Motherland Prosper" and female trio  "The Glow over Kangson" which our revolutionary artistes newly created by fully displaying their wisdom and enthusiasm recently are the outstanding monumental masterpieces in the era of Songun which are of landmark significance in the development of Juche-based music, he said, adding that this shining success is a striking demonstration of the validity and vitality of the WPK's policy of literature and arts. 
						
						 He expressed expectation and conviction that all the artistes would conduct dynamic revolutionary art activities in the future too, to powerfully encourage the army and people in the drive for accomplishing the cause of building a great prosperous powerful nation. 
						
						 Among the audience were Choe Thae Bok and Kim Ki Nam, secretaries of the C.C., the WPK, Jang Song Thaek, Ri Kwang Ho and Kim Yang Gon, department directors of the C.C., the WPK, and other leading officials of the C.C., the WPK and KPA Generals Hyon Chol Hae and Ri Myong Su and other commanding officers of the army.

articles.title: Congratulations to Zambian President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Zambian President

					
						Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a congratulatory message to Rupiah Bwezani Banda upon his inauguration as Zambian President.
						 Kim in the message said that his assumption of important post as president is an expression of the Zambian people's deep trust and expectation on him.
						
						 Expressing the belief that the excellent friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the future, the message wished the President great success in his work for national unity and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: DPRK Clarifies Its Will to Contribute to Int'l Efforts for Protection and Improvement of Human Rights
articles.content:
DPRK Clarifies Its Will to Contribute to Int'l Efforts for Protection and Improvement of Human Rights

					
						 Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- The government of the DPRK will as ever further strengthen and develop the Korean-style socialist system and positively contribute to the international efforts for the protection and improvement of human rights.
						 A delegate of the DPRK declared this when discussing the item "protection and improvement of human rights" at the meeting of the 3rd Committee of the 63rd UN General Assembly on Oct. 29.
						
						 The human rights issue is not a privileged monopoly granted to any specified country or to forces and there can be neither "judge" nor "defendant" as far as international human rights issues are concerned, he noted, and continued:
						
						 Some Western countries are politicizing human rights issues and selectively directing accusing fingers to those developing countries which refuse to accept their view on value. This practice aggravates the conflict among countries and adversely affects the worldwide efforts to protect and promote human rights. 
						
						 It is important to properly settle the past issues in solving human rights issues.
						
						 Recently, some countries have taken measures to make repentance, apology and compensation for the human rights abuses which they committed in their countries and other countries in the past. 
						
						 But it is regretful that only Japan has not sincerely made apology and reparation for the grave human rights abuses which it committed in Korea and other Asian countries in the past.
						
						The government of Japan has not admitted the state responsibility for killing at least a million Koreans, abducting and drafting more than 8.4 million Koreans and forcing 200,000 Korean women into sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army during its occupation of Korea and has refused to make state reparation to the victims.
						
						 What is more intolerable is that the discrimination and suppression of Koreans in Japan are now being committed in Japan in an undisguised manner.
						
						Japan should not forget that it will have no rosy future unless it has a will to honestly settle its past and awareness of the reality.

articles.title: New Stamps Issued
articles.content:
New Stamps Issued

					
						Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- New postage stamps (one souvenir sheet and seven individual stamps) were issued in the DPRK.
						 Printed in the souvenir sheet is a char of Lake Chon against the background of Lake Chon on the top of Mt. Paektu, the sacred mountain of revolution. 
						
						 The char, a speciality of Mt. Paektu under special protection of the International Biosphere Sanctuary, is a unique char, a river fish developed into a lake fish. After being moved to the water area of Lake Chon, it has been adapted to the severe meteorological, climatic and hydrologic conditions and ecological environment through decades.
						
						 The individual stamp issued on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of the enforcement of the universal compulsory secondary education depicts the happy looks of the students and children growing into  dependable pillars of the country, benefiting by free education.
						
						 Also printed in individual stamps are posters showing a People's Army soldier firmly defending the motherland with the rifle, regarding national defence as the supreme manifestation of patriotism, and a woman farmer full of ardor to do her bit in improving the dietary life of the people by reaping a bumper crop of soy bean.
						
						 There are individual stamps introducing Moran Hill, a scenic spot of Pyongyang.

articles.title: Golden Prize of Yellow Crane Awarded to DPRK Acrobats
articles.content:
Golden Prize of Yellow Crane Awarded to DPRK Acrobats

					
						Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- The 8th Wuhan International Acrobatics Festival took place in Wuhan, China, from Oct. 25 to 31. 
						 At its closing ceremony, golden prize of yellow crane was awarded to aerial stunt "Somersault in flight" and silver prize of yellow crane to physical stunt "Pole trick," both performed by DPRK acrobats. 
						
						 In the "Somersault in flight" women acrobats presented quadruple turns and quadruple flip-flap with a simultaneous pirouette, considered to be an ultramodern skill, and other complicated and difficult movements by use of a bar swing.

articles.title: DPRK Enters Quarterfinals of FIFA Women's World Cup
articles.content:
DPRK Enters Quarterfinals of FIFA Women's World Cup

					
						Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- The DPRK team advanced to the quarterfinals of the First FIFA U-17 Women's World Cup New Zealand 2008.
						 A match between the DPRK and German teams belonging to Group B of the group league matches of the championships took place on Nov. 4. It ended in a 1-1 draw.
						
						 Thus, the DPRK team clinched a berth in the quarterfinals by obtaining total 5 points in Group B league matches with one win and two draws in three matches.

articles.title: Kwangju Student Incident, Demonstration of Korean Youth's Stamina
articles.content:
Kwangju Student Incident, Demonstration of Korean Youth's Stamina

					
						Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- The mass struggle of student youth which started in Kwangju of Korea against the colonial rule of the Japanese imperialists in November Juche 18 (1929) was a historical one which demonstrated the patriotic spirit of young people to the full.
						The struggle was triggered off by a conflict between Korean and Japanese students with making sport of a Korean girl student by Japanese students in a train running between Kwangju and Raju on October 30, 1929 as an occasion.
						
						Enraged by the unjust step of the Japanese imperialist police which detained only Korean students, the victims, and the collective violence committed by Japanese teaching staff and students against Korean students on November one, two days after the incident, the entire Korean student youth in Kwangju launched a general strike all at once and held a mass anti-Japanese demonstration in early November.
						
						Shouting "Down with the Japanese imperialists!", "Abolish the colonial slave education!", "Let's recapture the arrested by our own efforts!", "Long live the independence of Korea!" and other slogans, the demonstrators scattered leaflets and made speeches in streets. They also surrounded the office of "Kwangju Ilbo", a paper controlled by Japanese imperialism, which published a distorted report of the incident and destroyed printing machines.
						
						The flames of the struggle sparked off by the students in Kwangju spread to Pyongyang, Seoul, Sinuiju, Hamhung, Kaesong, Taegu, Pusan and other parts of the country.
						
						According to the curtailed data released by the Japanese imperialists, more than sixty thousands of students of 194 schools and patriotic people of all strata around the country took part in the struggle during the nearly six months till April 1930.
						
						Though the patriotic struggle of Kwangju students was put down ruthlessly by the Japanese imperialists, it clearly demonstrated that no one could break the indomitable will of the Korean young people who loved the country and aspired after justice at the point of the bayonet.
						
						The Korean people still remember the Kwangju student incident stained with blood of guiltless young people and will certainly settle accounts with the inveterate Japanese reactionaries who are trying hard to make a comeback to Korea, far from apologizing and making reparation for the past crimes.

articles.title: Adherence to Idea of "By Our Nation Itself" Urged
articles.content:
Adherence to Idea of "By Our Nation Itself" Urged

					
						 Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- The idea of "By our nation itself" is the invincible idea for national reunification inspiringly encouraging all Koreans to the struggle for national reunification as it embodies the principle of national independence and the idea of national unity.
						 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a signed article.
						
						 The idea of "By our nation itself" set forth in the historic June 15 joint declaration is the idea for reunification common to the nation that conforms with the essence and nature of the issue of national reunification and positively encourages the Koreans to the realization of national reunification, the article notes, and goes on:
						
						 The members of the nation should be implanted with the consciousness of being the driving force of national reunification and the spirit of national independence that calls for achieving the country's reunification independently by concerted efforts of the Korean nation free from outsiders' interference. Herein lies the vitality of the idea of "By our nation itself." 
						
						 The said idea expounds the idea that the homogenous Koreans in the north and the south should achieve independent reunification by reconciling and closely uniting with each other on the basis of the principle of national independence and national identity.
						
						 The shining reality in the June 15 era of reunification goes to prove that any idea can never replace the idea of "By our nation itself" in the movement for national reunification and there is nothing impossible when the Koreans in the north and the south and abroad struggle, closely uniting themselves as one under the uplifted banner of the idea of "By our nation itself."
						
						 The Koreans in the north and the south and abroad should invariably uphold the idea of "By our nation itself" as the idea of national reunification in the future, too, and more vigorously wage the patriotic struggle to fully apply it to the reunification movement.

articles.title: U.S. Imperialists' Scenario for Preemptive Attack on DPRK Blasted
articles.content:
U.S. Imperialists' Scenario for Preemptive Attack on DPRK Blasted

					
						 Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialists are contemplating deploying in Guam ultra-modern war hardware such as refueling tanker, strategic bombers and latest-type unmanned high-altitude reconnaissance planes to cope with "contingency" on the Korean Peninsula. This move is part of the U.S. imperialists' policy of aggression towards the DPRK aimed to mount a surprise preemptive attack on it any time.
						 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes this in a signed commentary.
						
						 The U.S. move to beef up its air force in Guam suggests that the task force in the U.S. air force has a crucial offensive mission to perform in its strategy for a preemptive attack on the DPRK, the commentary notes, and goes on:
						
						 The U.S. imperialists' war strategy is to wage blitz warfare by a preemptive attack. In order to carry out this strategy the U.S. bellicose forces regard an air task force as a major war means for increasing the efficiency of preemptive strikes and attaining the desired aim.
						
						 The U.S. war-like forces seek to secure capability enough to launch a surprise attack on the DPRK by amassing air force in Guam and other areas of the Asia-Pacific. Their aim is to mobilize huge air force any moment to make a concentrated air strike at the DPRK. 
						
						 The method of preemptive attack may prove effective in wars with other countries but it does not work on the DPRK.
						
						 This method is not a monopoly of the U.S.
						
						 The U.S. bellicose forces had better give up their reckless scenario for a preemptive attack on the DPRK, pondering over what a dear price they will have to pay for it.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group Urged to Stop Hamstringing Efforts to Settle Nuclear Issue
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group Urged to Stop Hamstringing Efforts to Settle Nuclear Issue

					
						Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- Minister of "Foreign Affairs and Trade" of south Korea Ryu Myong Hwan, speaking at the recent "inspection of administration at the National Assembly," blustered that "in case the nuclear declaration of the north is different from the results of the nuclear verification, a measure for de-lifting various sanctions against the north would be brought up for discussion, to begin with."
						 Rodong Sinmun today observes in a signed commentary carried in this regard:
						
						 This is nothing but an ill-natured behavior of those displeased with the processes to solve the issue of the DPRK-U.S. relations and the nuclear issues. 
						
						 The improvement of the DPRK-U.S. relations would help defuse the military tension on the Korean Peninsula and bring about a phase favorable for national reunification, the desire of all Koreans. 
						
						 However, the Lee Myung Bak group, which considers sycophancy towards the U.S. and dependency on foreign forces as a means of its existence, is very much afraid of the fact that the improved DPRK-U.S. relations may lead to depriving the group of the means of living. It is, therefore, leaving no means untried to bar the above-said relations from improving come what may, utterly indifferent to the destiny of the nation.
						
						 A whole string of foolish remarks let loose by the group as regards the U.S. measure for delisting the DPRK as a "state sponsor of terrorism" betrays its worry that the situation may develop quite contrary to its wishes.
						
						 It is out of this uneasiness that the Lee group expresses veiled wish to see the above-said relations fester again over the nuclear issue and let loose a spate of reckless remarks calling for "de-lifting sanctions." This brought to light once again the treacherous nature of the group keen to stifle fellow countrymen in collusion with foreign forces, opposed to the development of the DPRK-U.S. relations and the inter-Korean relations and the solution of the nuclear issue.
						
						 It is preposterous for the Lee Myung Bak group to talk about "the de-lifting sanctions," unable to face up to the trend of the times.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppets' Military Exercises under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppets' Military Exercises under Fire

					
						Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- Hoguk exercises, large-scale joint military exercises now frantically under way in south Korea, are a provocative saber-rattling staged by the puppet warmongers in league with the U.S. to pull down the DPRK by force of arms.
						 Minju Joson Wednesday says this in a signed commentary.
						
						 The exercises are field mobile exercises staged by the puppet military to increase the "ability for carrying out operation plan and joint operation and integration combat" under the simulated condition of an all-out war for invasion of the DPRK, and they are a very dangerous military provocation for a war of aggression on the DPRK from A to Z in view of their nature, scale and program, the commentary notes, and goes on:
						
						 The warmongers are escalating the moves for a war to invade the DPRK while asserting that the north should be pressurized by a military edge. They have gone the length of frantically stepping up their preparations for a real "preemptive strike" after choosing the "theory of preemptive strike" at the DPRK, for which they excused themselves, as a basic striking mode against the DPRK, recklessly calling for "advance".
						
						 Shortly ago, they staged a "demonstration firepower" drill to which the "concept of preemptive strike" is applied.
						
						 Under such situation the puppet warmongers are staging the said exercises with the U.S. by mobilizing huge armed forces. This proves that their scheme for a war against the DPRK has been put on the phase of practical implementation.
						
						 Should the warmongers ignite a war against the DPRK its army will foil their "preemptive strike" with its preemptive strike beyond imagination based on striking means more powerful than a nuclear weapon.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il presencia funcion artistica conjunta
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il presencia funcion artistica conjunta

					
						Pyongyang, 5 de noviembre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, presencio junto con los oficiales y soldados del EPC la funcion artistica que ofrecieron en conjunto el Coro Benemerito Estatal y otras entidades artisticas centrales.
						Ademas del citado conjunto, actuaron los artistas de la banda "Unhasu", el Conjunto Artistico Mansudae, el Conjunto Operistico "Mar de Sangre" y el Conjunto Artistico Nacional.
						
						En la ocasion se presentaron variados programas como el coro "!Que reciba saludo!", el solo masculino y coro "Cancion de camaraderia", la musica orquestal y coro "Cae la nieve", el trio femenino "Kangson en crepusculo", el cuarteto femenino y coro mixto "!Que prospere la patria!".
						
						Terminada la funcion, el Dirigente respondio a la aclamacion de los ejecutantes y espectadores y felicito a los primeros por el exitoso espectaculo.
						
						Muy satisfecho de que los artistas del Coro Benemerito Estatal y las demas entidades artisticas centrales ofrecieron esta magnifica funcion de maximo nivel y perfecta en lo ideo-artistico, les expreso agradecimiento tras evaluar altamente sus exitos.
						
						La musica orquestal y coro "Cae la nieve", el cuarteto femenino y coro mixto "!Que prospere la patria!" y el trio femenino "Kangson en crepusculo", creados ultimamente por nuestros artistas revolucionarios dedicando toda su inteligencia y pasion constituyen excelentes obras monumentales de la epoca del Songun (priorizacion militar) que tienen significado trascendental en el desarrollo de la musica jucheana, destaco el Dirigente y anadio que este orgulloso exito es la prueba contundente de la justeza y vitalidad de la linea del PTC sobre la literatura y el arte.
						
						Expreso su esperanza y conviccion de que todos los artistas libraran tambien en el futuro con audacia sus actividades de creacion del arte revolucionario para estimular mucho al ejercito y al pueblo a la lucha por cumplir la causa de construccion de una gran potencia prospera.
						
						Le acompanaron en disfrutar la funcion los secretarios Choe Thae Bok y Kim Ki Nam y los jefes de departamento Jang Song Thaek, Ri Kwang Ho y Kim Yang Gon y otros cuadros responsables del CC del PTC y los generales de ejercito Hyon Chol Hae y Ri Myong Su y otros miembros directivos del EPC.

articles.title: RPDC contribuira a la proteccion de DDHH, subraya delegado coreano
articles.content:
RPDC contribuira a la proteccion de DDHH, subraya delegado coreano

					
						Pyongyang, 5 de noviembre (ATCC) -- En el futuro tambien, el gobierno de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea consolidara aun mas el regimen socialista al estilo coreano y contribuira activamente al esfuerzo internacional por proteger y fomentar los derechos humanos.
						Asi subrayo el delegado coreano durante el debate de la agenda "Proteccion y fomento de DDHH" de la reunion de la tercera comision del 63o periodo de sesiones de la Asamblea General de la ONU y continuo:
						
						El problema de DDHH no es un monopolio privilegiado de unos paises y fuerzas determinados y en el trato de este tema a escala internacional no puede estar el "juez" ni el "acusado".
						
						Algunos paises occidentales politizan el problema de DDHH y ofenden selectivamente a los paises en vias de desarrollo que no aceptan su concepcion de valor.
						
						Esto acrecienta el conflicto entre los paises y ejerce influencias negativas sobre el esfuerzo mundial por la proteccion y el fomento de DDHH.
						
						En este asunto resulta importante solucionar correctamente los problemas del pasado.
						
						Ultimamente, algunos paises toman las medidas para reflexionar de sus violaciones de DDHH cometidas en el pasado en casa y otros paises y pedir disculpas por estos casos y recompensarlos.
						
						Lamentablemente, Japon es el unico que no quiere pedir perdon ni indemnizar sus graves violaciones de DDHH cometidas en el pasado en Corea y otros paises asiaticos.
						
						El gobierno japones no reconoce la responsabilidad estatal por el genocidio de mas de un millon de coreanos, el secuestro y arresto a mas de 8 millones 400 mil y la conversion de 200 mil coreanas en "consoladoras sexuales" del viejo ejercito nipon, perpetrados durante la ocupacion del territorio coreano, y rehusa la indemnizacion estatal a las victimas de estos crimenes.
						
						Lo que no se puede pasar por alto es que se practican ahora de modo abierto en el archipielago japones la discriminacion y la represion a los coreanos residentes alli.
						
						Japon no debe olvidar que sin la liquidacion cabal del pasado criminal y la conciencia de la realidad, no le habra un futuro claro.

articles.title: Pieza acrobatica coreana gana "Premio de oro de ciguena amarilla"
articles.content:
Pieza acrobatica coreana gana "Premio de oro de ciguena amarilla"

					
						Pyongyang, 5 de noviembre (ATCC) -- En la ceremonia de clausura del VIII Festival Internacional de Circo de Wuhan, efectuado del 25 al 31 de octubre en esta ciudad china, se otorgaron el "Premio de oro de ciguena amarilla" y el mismo de plata a las piezas coreanas "Vuelos en el espacio con salto mortal" (acrobacia aerea) y "Habilidades con palo" (acrobacia corporal), respectivamente.
						Los actores de la primera pieza ejecutaron dificiles y complicados movimientos, inclusive una habilidad de punta en el columpio instalado en el aire.

articles.title: Editados en Corea nuevos sellos
articles.content:
Editados en Corea nuevos sellos

					
						 Pyongyang, 5 de noviembre (ATCC) -- En Corea fueron editados nuevos sellos (un papel enterizo de pequeno tamano y 7 sellos individuales).
						 En el primero esta dibujado el Salvelinus malman. chonjiensis KIM (una especie de salmon pluvius) con el lago Chon del Paektu, sagrado monte de la revolucion, en el fondo.
						
						 Este pez esta bajo la proteccion especial siendo una de las especialidades del monte Paektu definido como zona de proteccion de la biosfera internacional. 
						
						 Se trata del salmon pluvius que se traslado de las fuentes fluviales a la zona del lago Chon y se transmuto en una nueva especie al adaptarse durante varios decenios a las duras condiciones climaticas, hidrologicas y ecologicas de esta localidad.
						
						 En el sello individual emitido en ocasion del 50o aniversario del establecimiento del sistema de ensenanza secundaria obligatoria general se ven los ninos y escolares que crecen felices como futuros trabajadores fidedignos del pais beneficiandose de la ensenanza gratuita.
						
						 En los otros estan estampados los afiches mostrando a un soldado del Ejercito Popular de Corea decidido a defender firmemente la RPDC con el arma considerandolo como la maxima muestra del patriotismo y a una trabajadora agricola muy entusiasta por contribuir a la mejora de la vida alimentaria del pueblo al cultivar bien la soya.
						
						 Ademas, hay los sellos que presentan la colina Moran, lugar famoso de Pyongyang.
